citation.article-title: Uruburuella suis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from clinical specimens of pigs
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Uruburuella (U.ru.bu.ru.el′la. L. dim. ending -ella; N.L. fem. dim. n. Uruburuella in memory of the Spanish microbiologist Federico Uruburu, for his contributions to the promotion and strengthening of the Spanish Type Culture Collection).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, non-motile coccobacilli.
Facultatively anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Produces acid from glucose and some other sugars.
Long-chain fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and monounsaturated types, with C16 : 0, C16 : 1 cis-9 and C18 : 1 cis-11 predominating.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type species is 55 mol%.
The genus Uruburuella is a member of the family Neisseriaceae in the β-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
The type species of the genus is Uruburuella suis.
